alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 3:38PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT/515 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe and Rhea. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT /515 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM CDT /436 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or still possible in the advisory area especially in the southern part of the advisory in Rhea County for the next 30 minutes. Doppler radar estimated between 1 and 2.0 inches of rain have fallen in the past 2 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spring City, Stinging Fork Falls State Park, Melvine, Piney Falls State Park and Grandview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
